結局、午前中のテストの補習で随分時間を取られてしまった。\n慌ててシミュレーター: In the end, the supplementary exams this morning took up quite a bit of time. I hurried to the simulator training and ran to the simulation room.
昼飯ぐらいゆっくり食べたかったけれど、\n今は贅沢を言える立場ではないのもわかっ: I wanted to eat lunch slowly, but I know I'm not in a position to be extravagant right now.
まずは『ここに不要な人間』だと思われないよう、頑張らなくては。: First of all, I have to do my best not to be thought of as an unnecessary person here.
ん？ シリウスシュガーのみんなか。\nそちらの彼が、噂の生徒会付きの教導指揮官か: Hm? Everyone from Sirius Sugaru, huh? <b>So that's the instructor with the rumored student council?
どうやら先客のようだ。\n５人の少女達が立ちはだかる。:
Looks like they're here first. The five
girls stand in my way.
えーっと……この子達は？: Let's see... What about these girls?
私達と同じ柊校舎のパイロットチーム、\n『カラフルブーケ』の皆さんです。:
They're all members of the Hiiragi building's pilot team, the
'colorful bouquet', just like us.
私達よりも前にチーム結成されていて、\n経験も成績も柊校舎トップクラスなんです。: They formed a team before us, and their experience and grades are top class in the Hiiragi building.
紹介、感謝する。私はカラフルブーケの生駒葵。\n以後、お見知りおきを。:
Thank you for the introduction. I'm Aoi Ikoma of the colorful bouquet. It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance after the
.
夕凪舞亜よ。ここで出会ったのも何かの縁かしら。: It's Maia Yuunagi. I wonder if it's fate that we met here.
こっちが泉花とクララ、うるうね。: This is Izumika and Clara. Shut up.
はじめまして、姫川泉花よ。自分で言うのもなんだけど、\n一応このチームの参謀を担: Nice to meet you, Izumika Himekawa. I'm technically in charge of this team's staff officers, if I do say so myself.
あ、あ、え、えっと……波瀬うるう……です。: Ah, ah, u-umm... It's... Uruu Namise.
クララよ、綺羅クララ。見た感じ、大したことなさそうねぇ。: Clara, Clara. From what I can tell, it doesn't look that big of a deal.
すまない、みんな緊張しているんだ。\n男子生徒と会話するなんて、初めての経験だか: Sorry, everyone's nervous. This is the first time I've had a conversation with a male <b> student.
本当に緊張のせいなのか……？: Is it really because I'm nervous...?
ところで……お前達シリウスシュガーは、\n次のＭＧ競技で負けたら解散、退学と聞い: By the way...I heard that you Sirius Sugaru are disbanded and expelled if you lose the next MG event. Is that true?
ぜーったい、そんなことにはしないけどね！: I'm definitely not gonna do that, though!
ふむ……対戦相手はスカラ校舎の精鋭、カオスメイデンと聞いている。\n今の私たちが: Hmm... I've heard that our opponent is Chaos Maiden, an elite member of the Scara school building. <b>She's a tough opponent even for us to fight right now.
だが、生徒会もお前たちに期待するところがあるからこそ、\n彼に指導を命じたのだろ:
However, the student council must have ordered the
to instruct him precisely because they have high hopes for you as well.
鍛錬は裏切らない。期日まで、鍛え上げることだ。\nもちろん、私たちが力になれるこ:
I won't betray my training. I'll train until the end of time.
Of course, if there's anything we can do to help, please let me know.
同じ柊校舎のチームがいなくなるのは、寂しいからな。: It'd be lonely without a team from the same Hiiragi building.
ありがとうございます。がんばります！: Thank you. I'll do my best!
ああ。その目、信じているよ。: Yes. I believe in your eyes.
そう言って、カラフルブーケのメンバーたちは去っていった。: With that, the members of the colorful bouquet left.
葵さんいい人ですよね。強いし、カッコいいし。素敵です。: Aoi-san is a good person, isn't she? She's strong, cool, and wonderful.
ですわね。でも、彼女たちもライバルであることは\n忘れてはなりませんわよ。: You're right. But don't forget that they're rivals, too.
へん。いつかまとめて蹴散らしてヤるつーの。: Heh. Someday, I'll kick them all out at once.
ところで、ひとつ聞いていいか？: By the way, can I ask you something?
そもそも、どうしてチーム解散だの退学だのって\n話になってるんだ？: Why are we talking about disbanding the team and being expelled from school in the first place?
いや、成績が良くなくて、落ちこぼれ扱いなのは聞いたが……\nあまり詳細を聞いてな:
Well, my grades weren't good, so I heard I was being treated like a washout, but...
I didn't feel like I'd heard much detail.
口に出して言いたくないだろうけど、聞いておきたい。: I'm sure she doesn't want to say it out loud, but I want to hear it.
そうね……まずメイズが危険なのは、前に身を以て経験したよね？: That's right... First of all, you've experienced the dangers of the Maze, haven't you?
ああ……メイズシフターだったか？\n妙な化け物は出るし、あちこち入り組んでいて地:
Ahh... Was it a maise shifter? There are strange monsters coming out of the
, and the terrain is complicated because it’s complicated here and there.
うん、だから基本私達はチームで活動することが多いの。\nごく浅い区域なら少数でも: Yeah, that's why we usually work as a team. Though if it's in a very shallow area, even a small number of people get permission to mine.
そしてチームごとに採掘できる範囲、深さが異なります。: And each team has a different range and depth to mine.
実力のないチームは出入り口――ポータルに近い狭い範囲のみ、\n実力のあるチームは:
A team that doesn't have the ability to go in and out—only in a narrow area close to the portal, and a team with the power of
can go in deeper and wider areas...
やはり地形の複雑さもメイズシフターの強さも、\n深くなるにつれて大きくなっていき:
As I thought, both the complexity of the terrain and the strength of the maise shifters grow as the
deepens.
採掘する深さって、深いほどいいのか？: The deeper you mine, the better?
そりゃそーでしょ。浅いとこって言っちゃえば、\nもうみんな取り尽くしちゃったとこ:
Of course it is. To put it bluntly, the
has already completely devoured everyone.
探しても探しても、お目当てのタツミヤ鉱なんてめったに出ない。: No matter how hard you search, you rarely find the Tatsumiya Ore you're looking for.
だから掘って得られるラミ達の報酬も、雀の涙ってワケ。\n機体の改修とか夢のまた夢:
That's why the reward you get from digging is also a sparrow's tear. Repairing the
machine is a dream come true.
出たら前みたいに取り合いですね……: Once we're out, we'll fight like we used to...
それで……その範囲と深さ――エリアを決めるために、\n『公式ＭＧ競技』というもの:
So...to determine its range and depth—the area—the
'Official MG Competition' will be held.
一言で言えば、ＭＧ同士で戦闘する催しのこと。: To put it simply, it was an event where MGs fought each other.
ま、簡単に言えば勝てば勝つほど、\n実力が認められて担当区域が広くなるってわけ。:
Well, to put it simply, the more you win, the bigger the area you're in charge of because your
abilities are recognized.
学園側としては生徒達のＭＧ操縦技術が上がれば、\nそれだけメイズ探索も進みますか:
As far as the school is concerned, the higher the MG piloting skills of the students, the better the
Mayse search.
なるほどな……だいたいわかってきたよ。つまり……: I see... I'm starting to get the gist of it. In other words...
ＭＧ競技に勝てない、だからタツミヤ鉱の多い採掘エリアを\n担当できない、それで稼: You can't win the MG Games, so you can’t be in charge of the <b> mining area with lots of Tatsumiya ore, and that won’t earn you any money, so the aircraft can’T be strong...
以下、無限ループってことか。: So the following is an infinite loop.
そうなると、もうチームを存続させる意味が薄れてしまって……: If that's the case, there's no longer any point in keeping the team alive...
結構厳しいんだな……救済措置とかないのか？\n敗者復活戦みたいな……: It's pretty tough... Don't we have a relief measure? It'll be like a rematch for the losers...
一応、特別養成校舎という学園自体が運営する、\n問題児達を集めて所属校舎復帰を目: Just in case, there's a special training building, which is run by the school itself. It's like a training hall where students from the <bl> problem children gather and return to their school buildings.
あれ？ なら、どうして退学なんて話に……？: Huh? Then why did we have to talk about being expelled...?
まずわたくし達は入学後基礎訓練課程を受講するんです。: First of all, we're going to take the basic training course after entering the academy.
それをクリアした人がチームを組み、\n水準を満たせなかった人が特別養成校舎にいき:
Those who clear that will form a team, and those who fail to meet the
level will go to the special training building.
……となると、少なくともシリウスシュガーのみんなは、\nその一定基準はクリアして:
...Which means that at least everyone in Sirius Sugaru has cleared a certain standard for
.
えっへん。だからラミたちは意外とエラいんだよ！\nわかったかなー？:
Ehem. That's why Rami and the others are surprisingly good! Do you understand
?
おー、えらいえらい。あとでお菓子あげるから少し静かにしててな。: Oh, that's great. I'll give you some sweets later, so be quiet for a bit.
だからガキ扱いすんな！: Like I said, don't treat me like a kid!
チームを組んだ学生――つまり正式に一度パイロットとなった学生は、\n特別養成校舎:
Students who team up—in other words, students who have officially become pilots once—will never go to the
special training building.
結果を出せない正式パイロットの行く道は、\n解散と退学のみです。:
The only way for an official pilot who can't produce results is to disband and expel the
.
要するに、一度いわばデビューしたわけなんだから、\n甘えんなってことね。:
Basically, I made my debut once, so to speak, so don't be spoiled by
.
救済措置はあるが、お前らはすでにその対象外ってことか。\n厳しい世界なんだな。:
There's a relief measure, but you guys are already out of that category, huh? The
world is pretty harsh.
なるほど……みんな、教えてくれてありがとう。\nつまりこういうことか……まずは公:
I see... Thank you for telling me, everyone. So this is what it means to be a
... First, we need to win the official MG competition.
そういうことに、なりますわね。\nまあ、それができれば苦労しないのですが……: That's how it is. <b>Well, if I could do that, I wouldn't have any trouble...
そのための俺だろ？: That's what I'm here for, isn't it?
うわ、ドヤりやがった。ちょっと指揮上手いだけで、\nどこにそんな自信があるんだか:
Whoa, she's smug. She's just a little good at commanding, but where's her
confidence in that?
自信というよりやる気だよ。俺だって結果を出さないと、\nこの先どうなるかわからな:
I'm more motivated than confident. Even I don't know what'll happen to the
if I don’t produce results.
だから俺も出来る限りのことはする。一緒に頑張ろう。: That's why I'll do what I can. Let's do our best together.
%usernameusernameuserna%さん……はい、こちらこそ、お願い: %username, username, userna%-san... Yes, I'm counting on you too!
では、早速、訓練を始めますわよ。時間は限られていますから。: Well then, let's begin training right away. We don't have much time.
%usernameusernameuserna%には、\nとりあえず見学していて: %username, username, userna% would be better off having <b> observe for now, wouldn't it?
それで、あたしたちの問題点がわかれば、指摘して欲しい。: If you find out what's wrong with us, I want you to point it out.
わかった。任せろ。: All right. Leave it to me.
